text: Muttalib ibn Abd al-Manaf (, Muṭṭalib ibn Abd al-Manāf) was one of the ancestors of the Sahaba of Muhammad. ==History== His father was Abd Manaf ibn Qusai. Muttalib was the younger brother of Hashim ibn Abd Manaf (the great- grandfather of Muhammad). Muttalib succeeded his brother Hashim and took care of his nephew Shaiba ibn Hashim, when Muttalib returned to Mecca with his nephew people thought he was his new slave, so Shaiba became known as "Abd al- Muttalib" (servant of Muttalib) because slavery was so common and rampant at that time. When Muttalib died, Abd al-Muttalib succeeded him. He is the progenitor of Banu Muttalib. == Family tree == == Further reading == * Geraldine de Gaury, Rulers of Mecca ==See also== *Sahaba == References == ==External links== *Banu Hashim - Before the Birth of Islam Category:5th- century Arabs Category:510s deaths Category:Year of birth unknown Category:Quraysh
